main.com.univlr.commons

Class WorldAgent

  • java.lang.Object
    • jade.core.Agent
      • main.com.univlr.commons.StateChartAgent
        • main.com.univlr.commons.WorldAgent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    jade.core.TimerListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable

    public abstract class WorldAgent
extends StateChartAgent
    An abstract descriptor that represents a JADE agent existing in a World. As the agents are using a StateChartBehaviour, this class is extending StateChartAgent.
    Author:
    Antoine Orgerit
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public void setup()
        Overrides:
        setup in class StateChartAgent

      • getPosition

        public java.awt.Point getPosition()
        Retrieves the position of the WorldAgent in the World.
        Returns:
        the position of the agent as a Point

      • move

        public void move()
        Allows to move the WorldAgent randomly in the World.

      • moveTo

        private void moveTo(char direction)
        Allows to move the WorldAgent in a specified direction. The position of the agent in the World is updated.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction on which to move the agent as a character which value has to be 'N', 'E', 'S' or 'W'

      • moveTo

        protected void moveTo(java.awt.Point destination)
        Allows to move the WorldAgent in a specific direction in order to reach a particular destination.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination to which the agent wants to move as a Point

      • moveAwayFrom

        protected void moveAwayFrom(java.awt.Point position)
        Allows to move the WorldAgent away from a specific position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to avoid as a Point

      • moveToPossibleDirections

        private void moveToPossibleDirections(java.util.List<java.lang.Character> potentialDirections)
        Allows to move the WorldAgent to one of the potential directions passed in parameters, according to its current position.
        Parameters:
        potentialDirections - the potential directions to which the agent can move as a List of Characters

      • randomDirection

        private char randomDirection()
        Allows to generate a random direction according to which direction the WorldAgent cannot take.
        Returns:
        the random direction generated as a character which value is one of the following: 'N', 'E', 'S' or 'W'

      • excludedDirections

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Character> excludedDirections()
        Allows to evaluate the directions the WorldAgent cannot take according to its current position in the World.
        Returns:
        the directions the agent cannot take as a List of characters, which values can zero, one or two of the following: 'N', 'E', 'S' or 'W'

      • destinationPossibleDirections

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Character> destinationPossibleDirections(java.awt.Point destination)
        Allows to determine the possible directions the WorldAgent can take in order to reach a particular destination.
        Parameters:
        destination - the destination the agent wants to reach as a Point
        Returns:
        the possible directions the agent can take to reach its destination as a List of characters, which values can be one or two of the following: 'N', 'E', 'S' or 'W'

      • possibleDirectionsAwayFrom

        private java.util.List<java.lang.Character> possibleDirectionsAwayFrom(java.awt.Point position)
        Allows to determine the possible directions the WorldAgent can take in order to avoid a particular position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position to avoid as a Point
        Returns:
        the possible directions the agent can take to avoid the position as a List of characters, which values can be one or two of the following: 'N', 'E', 'S' or 'W'

      • drawAgent

        protected void drawAgent(double oldX,
                         double oldY,
                         int oldSize,
                         double newX,
                         double newY,
                         int newSize)
        Allows to draw the WorldAgent in the World.
        Parameters:
        oldX - the old X axis position of the agent as a double
        oldY - the old Y axis position of the agent as a double
        oldSize - the old size of the agent as an integer
        newX - the new X axis position of the agent as a double
        newY - the new Y axis position of the agent as a double
        newSize - the new size of the agent as an integer

      • getAgentColor

        protected abstract java.awt.Color getAgentColor()
        Retrieves the color of the WorldAgent in the World. This method must be implemented by subclasses to return the desired color of the agent in the world.
        Returns:
        the color of the agent as a Color

      • getWorldAgentSize

        protected abstract int getWorldAgentSize()
        Retrieves the WorldAgent size in the World. This method must be implemented by subclasses to return the desired size of the agent in the world.
        Returns:
        the size of the agent as an integer

      • getAgentWorld

        protected abstract World getAgentWorld()
        Retrieves the World in which the WorldAgent evolves. This method must be implemented by subclasses to return the corresponding world in which the agent is evolving.
        Returns:
        the world of the agent as a World
